it.polimi.travlendarplus.RESTful.RESTfulCalendar

Class PreferenceRESTful

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.travlendarplus.RESTful.RESTfulCalendar.PreferenceRESTful

  • @Path(value="/preference")
public class PreferenceRESTful
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provide all RESTful methods related to handle the user's preferences This RESTful resource will be hosted at the relative URI path "/preference"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private User authenticatedUser
      User that performs a request, automatically injected after his authentication
      private PreferenceManager preferenceManager
      Enterprise Java beans that offers the logic related to preference-related functionalities

      PreferenceRESTful()

    • Method Detail

      • postConstruct

        @PostConstruct
public void postConstruct()
        This method initialize the injected preference manager with the user to be handled It will be executed before any request is actually performed

      • getPreferencesProfiles

        @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPreferencesProfiles()
        Allows the user to retrieve all preferences profile
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code and all the preference profiles of the user ( in the message body )

      • getPreferencesProfile

        @Path(value="/{id}")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPreferencesProfile(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                                                                          long id)
        Allows the user to retrieve a specific preference profile
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the requested profile
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code and the requested profile ( in the message body ) if present, an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code otherwise

      • addPreference

        @POST
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addPreference(AddTypeOfEventMessage typeOfEventMessage)
        Allows the user to add a new preference profile
        Parameters:
        typeOfEventMessage - message containing the info of the new profile
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code if the request is fulfilled or HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code otherwise ( that means there are invalid fields, the wrong ones are specified in the message body )

      • modifyPreference

        @PATCH
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response modifyPreference(ModifyTypeOfEventMessage typeOfEventMessage)
        Allows the user to modify one of his preference profiles
        Parameters:
        typeOfEventMessage - message containing the info of the profile to be modified
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code if the request is fulfilled or HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code otherwise ( in the body is specified which fields are wrong, if the body is empty the preferred location to be modified does not exist )

      • deletePreference

        @Path(value="{idPreference}")
 @DELETE
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deletePreference(@PathParam(value="idPreference")
                                                                                                                                 long id)
        It allows the user to delete a previously inserted preference profile
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the profile to be deleted
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code if the request is fulfilled or HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code if the specified profile does not exist

      • getAllPreferredLocations

        @Path(value="/location")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAllPreferredLocations()
        Allows the user to retrieve all his preferred locations
        Returns:
        all the preferred location of the authenticated user

      • getPreferredLocation

        @Path(value="/location/{locationName}")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPreferredLocation(@PathParam(value="locationName")
                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String locationName)
        It allows to obtain the info related to a specific preferred location
        Parameters:
        locationName - name of the location, set by the user
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code and the requested location ( in the message body ) if present, an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code otherwise

      • addPreferredLocation

        @Path(value="/location")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addPreferredLocation(PreferredLocationMessage locationMessage)
        It allows the user to add a specific preferred location
        Parameters:
        locationMessage - message containing the location info
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code if the request is fulfilled or HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code otherwise ( that means there are invalid fields, the wrong ones are specified in the message body )

      • modifyPreferredLocation

        @Path(value="/location")
 @PATCH
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response modifyPreferredLocation(PreferredLocationMessage locationMessage)
        It allows the user to modify a previously inserted preferred location
        Parameters:
        locationMessage - describe the fields to be modified
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code if the request is fulfilled or HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code otherwise ( in the body is specified which fields are wrong, if the body is empty the preferred location to be modified does not exist )

      • deletePreferredLocation

        @Path(value="/location/{name}")
 @DELETE
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deletePreferredLocation(@PathParam(value="name")
                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String name)
        It allows the user to delete a previously inserted preferred location
        Parameters:
        name - identifier of the preferred location to be deleted
        Returns:
        an HTTP 200 OK success status response code if the request is fulfilled or an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code if the preferred location specified does not exist
